data.title: Turkish marble colors and types
data.meta_description: Turkish Marble: From Afyon White to Emperador Beige, experience Turkey's marble elegance in vibrant patterns and colors.
data.text:
“Turkish Marble Colors and Types: “

Marble is a natural gem known for its captivating beauty and luxury that it adds to any commercial or personal project. Turkish stone and marble are among the most famous types of natural stones used in construction and decoration around the world. But did you know that there is a wonderful diversity in the colors and patterns of Turkish marble?

In this article, we will explore a variety of Turkish marble types and categorize them by their natural colors, which are extracted from the Turkish quarries spread across all Turkish provinces:

Introduction to Turkish Marble Colors and Types:

Turkish marble comes in a stunning range of colors and patterns that make it unique for construction and decoration projects. Turkish marble can be classified based on its primary color into several main categories: white, beige, gray, black, brown, and green. In this article, we will take a closer look at some of the prominent types of Turkish marble.

Turkish White Marble

Turkish white marble is one of the most famous and elegant types of marble in the world. This type of marble is distinguished by its unique beauty and exceptional aesthetic value. Some well-known types of Turkish white marble include:

Afyon White Marble: Afyon white marble is extracted from the mountains of Afyon province in central Anatolia, Turkey. It is known for its uniqueness and high durability, making it ideal for various applications such as flooring, walls, kitchens, swimming pools, and even artistic sculptures.

Muğla White Marble:

Muğla white marble is extracted from the mountains of Muğla province in southern Turkey on the Mediterranean coast. It features attractive dark gray veins that add extra charm, and some varieties are free of veins, offering a pure white appearance for those seeking pristine whiteness in their homes or kitchens.

Carrara White Marble: Also known in the local market by various names, including Bianco Ibiza, Carrara white marble is known for its pure white color with subtle gray veins that naturally enhance marble surfaces. It is highly popular in the market and widely used in homes and buildings to provide a clean and elegant appearance.

Calacatta White Marble:

Famous for its white color and dark veins, Calacatta white marble is considered a rare luxury stone. It is used in luxurious villas, upscale projects, and five-star hotels.

Kemal Paşa White Marble: Also known as “Kemal Paşa,” this Turkish marble is extracted from the city of Bursa in Turkey and is a renowned product exported worldwide. Turkish marble enjoys a distinctive reputation in the global market, with high demand, especially from the Arab Gulf countries and North Africa. It competes with Italian and Spanish varieties in terms of beauty and quality.

Turkish white marble with delicate silver veins is among the most beautiful and distinctive types of marble. It is primarily used in large-scale projects such as building facades, mosques, and commercial centers. Additionally, this type of marble finds wide usage in interior and exterior decor, including wall cladding, elevator doors, and staircases.

Turkish white marble is valued for its strength, durability, and unparalleled white luster. It is commonly used in interior and exterior decorations and excels in mosaic work, garden ornamentation, and sculptures.

Limra White Limestone (Turkish White Limestone):

Limestone is a wonderful type of natural stone used extensively in construction, decoration, ornamentation, and sculptures in palaces and villas. This type of stone is also known as limestone, limestone, or sesame stone and is available in many Turkish quarries, mostly found in Antalya, Turkey. If you are looking for a natural stone that adds warmth to the exterior of your home or project, Turkish natural limestone is the ideal choice. Choose a facade that reflects the luxury of your project in its best form.

Turkish Beige, Dark Brown, and Light Brown Marble: Beige marble is characterized by its warm colors, including creamy and ivory tones. Dozens of Turkish beige marble types are extracted from various regions across Turkey, from its east to west, north to south. Some of the most well-known Turkish beige marble types include:

Emperador Beige Marble

Cappuccino Beige Marble

Emperador Light Beige Marble

King Beige Marble

Border Beige Marble

Diana Royal Beige Marble

Beige Bilecik Marble

Harmony Beige Marble

Konya Beige Marble

Almond Beige Marble

Bazaar Beige Marble

Taurus Beige Marble, extracted from the Taurus Mountains.

Turkey is renowned for the quality of its marble extracted from its numerous mountains, especially beige marble, which has a big name in the global market. It is widely used in various architectural and decorative projects, providing elegance and luxury.

Natural Stone (Turkish Travertine Beige): One of the famous types of Turkish marble used in interior and exterior installations is Turkish travertine stone, which comes in various types and colors. What concerns us in this section of this article is the light beige type. You can learn more about this type by reading the following article: Turkish Travertine: Characteristics, Applications, Different Types, and Locations.

Gray marble exudes sophistication and elegance.

Turkish Gray and Silver Marble: Gray marble exudes sophistication and elegance. Turkish gray and silver marble come in various shades and patterns, making them suitable for a wide range of applications. Some notable types include:

Silver Shadow Gray Marble

Serpeggiante Gray Marble

Gray Aspendos Marble

Silver Serpeggiante Marble

Gray Selene Marble

Gray Horizonte Marble

Turkish Black Marble: Black marble is synonymous with luxury and opulence. Turkish black marble is no exception. It is available in several varieties, including:

Black Marquina Marble

Turkish Black Gold Marble

Black Silver Portoro Marble

Black Sea Marble

Nero Marquina Turkish Marble

Eregli Black Marble

Turkish black marbles elevate any space – flooring, countertops, or decor.

Green Marble: Green marble offers a refreshing and unique look. Turkish green marble types include:

Jade Marble

Toscano Marble

Gokceada Marble

Ming Green Marble

These green marbles are excellent choices for creating a serene and elegant atmosphere in interior spaces.

Turkish Marble: Discovering Its Unique Patterns and Stunning Colors

Marble is a natural gem renowned for its exquisite beauty and the touch of luxury it adds to any commercial or personal project. Turkish stone and marble are among the most famous types of natural stones used in construction and decoration worldwide.

But did you know that there is a splendid variety of colors and patterns in Turkish marble? In this article, we will explore a diverse range of Turkish marble types and categorize them based on their natural colors extracted from quarries scattered across various Turkish states:

Introduction to Turkish Marble Colors and Types:

Turkish marble boasts a mesmerizing array of colors and patterns, making it a unique choice for architectural and decorative projects. Turkish marble can be categorized into several main color groups: white, beige, gray, black, brown, and green. Let’s take a closer look at some of the most prominent Turkish marble types:

Turkish White Marble:

Turkish white marble is one of the most famous and elegant types of marble globally. This type of marble is distinguished by its unique beauty and exceptional aesthetic value. Some renowned Turkish white marble types include:

Afyon White Marble (Afyon Beyaz Marble): Extracted from the mountains of Afyon in central Anatolia, Turkey, this white marble stands out for its uniqueness and high durability, making it ideal for various applications such as flooring, walls, kitchens, swimming pools, and even artistic sculptures.

Muğla Beyaz Marble

Muğla White Marble (Muğla Beyaz Marble): Extracted from the mountains of Muğla in southern Turkey along the Mediterranean coast, this Turkish white marble features attractive dark gray veins that add extra allure. Some varieties lack veins, offering a pure white surface, perfect for homes or kitchens.

Carrara White Marble: Also known as “Bianco Ibiza” in the local market, it is characterized by its pure white color with subtle gray veins, naturally enhancing marble surfaces. It is widely used in homes and buildings to achieve a clean and elegant appearance.

Calacatta White Marble: Known for its white color and dark veins, Calacatta white marble is a rare and luxurious stone, favored for use in upscale villas, high-end projects, and five-star hotels.

Kemal Paşa

Kemal Paşa White Marble: Also known as “Kemal Paşa” this Turkish marble is extracted from the city of Bursa in Turkey and is a well-known product exported worldwide.

Turkish marble, including Kemal Paşa, has a distinct reputation in the global market, with high demand, especially from the Arabian Gulf countries and North Africa.

It competes in beauty and quality with Italian and Spanish varieties.

Turkish white marble with delicate silver veins is among the most beautiful and distinctive marble types. It finds primary use in large projects such as building facades, mosques, and commercial centers. Additionally, this marble type is widely used in interior décor, such as wall cladding, elevator doors, and staircases. Turkish marble is renowned for its strength, durability, and unparalleled white brilliance, making it a common choice for both interior and exterior designs, as well as mosaic art, garden ornamentation, and sculptures.

Turkish Beige and Dark Brown Marble:

Beige marble is known for its warm colors, including creamy and ivory hues. There are numerous types of Turkish beige marble extracted from various regions across Turkey, both in the east and west. Some of the most well-known Turkish beige marble types include:

Tundra Gray : This stone is extracted from several locations in Turkey, with the mountains of Sivas being the most famous for producing this type of stone.

Afyon Gray Marble: Afyon Gray marble shares the same luxury and durability as its white counterpart, thanks to the white veins that adorn its gray surface. These veins add an elegant touch, making it visually appealing and comfortable to the eye. This marble is commonly used in both interior and exterior designs and shines particularly in mosaic pieces, garden embellishments, and sculptures.

Other popular Turkish beige marble types include:

Moon Stone Beige Marble: Known for its versatile application in both indoor and outdoor settings, this Turkish marble offers elegance and sophistication.

Bursa Beige Marble: Bursa Beige marble is celebrated for its exquisite appearance, making it a favorite choice for various projects.

Emotion Beige Marble: Offering a unique combination of beige and dark hues, Emotion Beige marble is a sought-after choice for luxurious designs.

Kütahya Beige Marble: This Turkish marble features earthy beige tones and is highly valued for its quality and elegance.

Bursa Beige Marble: Known for its versatile application in both indoor and outdoor settings. this Turkish marble offers elegance and sophistication.

Imperial Gray: This dark gray Turkish marble is often associated with luxury and is suitable for buildings with good lighting and spacious interiors.

Some of the Turkish beige and dark brown marbles listed above are extracted from specific regions and exhibit unique characteristics. These marbles are highly sought after in the global market,particularly in countries such as Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Qatar, and the United Arab Emirates.

Turkish Black Marble:

Black marble is commonly associated with luxury and is used in buildings with ample natural light and spacious areas. Some examples of Turkish black marble include:

Bursa Black Marble: Bursa Black marble exhibits a deep, elegant black color and is a popular choice.
